pTitle: AT&T Huawei Ascend XT GoPhone Prepaid Smartphone
rText:
I purchased this phone on Black Friday for about $50. I was able to update it after setting it up, Im guessing it was an ATT update. The phone comes with Marshmallow 6.0.1 and it has asked for a lot of permissions. First phone I have used with Marshmallow, so it has taken me a little time to get used to it. Also my first Huawei phone and so far so good.

 So far it has run smoothly and the battery life is excellent. I don't play any games on the phone and rarely use it for music or video, so your battery life might vary. Its only dropped 35% in the last 13 hours....

The phone helped walk me through transferring my contacts, pictures, video and texts from my old phone to this one. ( wi-fi required ) I was thankful for that!

 My biggest concern was where to find a case? Luckily the Walmart it was purchased from had a case made by Body Glove for the Huawei Ascend XT for $20.
 I only saw 2 colors to choose from, black and dark purple (grape). Fits it really well and make me worry less. Its not the most fancy of cases but internet searching didn't find anything. 

Phone calls have been clear for the most part but I have noticed some calls sound kinda tinny coming through the ear speaker. As far as the main speaker its loud but doesn't sound the best turned up all the way, it also sounds tinny to me.

The phone apps scroll up and down, I prefer side to side but not a deal breaker. It comes with a little bloatware but most can be disabled. It installed the apps I use really quickly from playstore.

It comes stock with the Google Sound Search ( widget) which recognizes music thats playing and names the artist and song. I don't know if thats old technology but I thought it was pretty nice.

The camera offers a lot of options for taking photos and photos so far have turned out good. Ive included a photo of the case and package.
rTitle: Nice phone and found a phone case to fit

pTitle: AT&T Huawei Ascend XT GoPhone Prepaid Smartphone
rText:
I needed to replace a lost phone and with Black Friday looming, this seemed like a good candidate. Reviews were scarce at the time cause the phone was so new but I figured if Huawei was good enough for Google, then it should be good enough for me. Besides, at the BF price it was basically a disposable phone.  I should mention that I am NOT an AT&T customer but instead use TMo, so to unlock the phone you must NOT turn on the phone with the included AT&T Sim, which is nano sized, by the way. Instead, you go to their website - https://www.att.com/deviceunlock/ and enter the IMEI # and in 2-3 days they email you back the code. 
  So, now that I have my TMo sim card in the phone and turn it on, it will ask for the unlock code and after entering it, the phone is now on TMo. This phone has band 12 for 4g LTE so it is fully compatible. The phone is large, which I like, but not too large for my manly hand to handle. I also got a Body Glove case for it at Walmart but if you ask an associate about it, they may tell you they don't carry it, Just go look on the shelf where the universal cases are at and you'll probably find one. It says" Huawei Ascend XT" in BIG letters right on the front. It's a little pricey at $20, but it's the ONLY case available right now. Screen protector from Amazon and now I'm good to go.
  I like to use my phone with PdaNet (Paid Version) so that I can access the internet with my laptop or tablet from anywhere. It connects right away through USB or Bluetooth but is a little glitchy through Wifi. The screen is bold and beautiful and sufficient for watching Youtube videos. Volume is more than adequate. Call quality hasn't been an issue when I've used it , but I don't talk on the phone much anyways.
  The only negative I have with this phone is the UI that Huawei uses over the Marshmallow 6.0. It takes some getting used to. But overall, I am very happy with this phone purchase, so happy that I went and bought a second one so that I have a back-up - just in case I lose this one too. For anyone needing a cheap phone for themselves or their kids, this is the best bang for the buck.
rTitle: Easy to unlock, nice size. Great bang for the buck

I bought two of these for my kids. 

Good: The battery is amazing. Runs Marshmallow. Decent camera. Runs apps with no lag. Sound/speaker quality is better than expected. Pretty impressive for the price. Screen quality is good.

Bad:The box says 16 GB internal memory, but it only has 8 GB. The ability to move apps to the sd card has been disabled by the manufacturer. I'm concerned about  not having enough rooms for apps. The phone comes with quite a bit of bloatware.  We disabled what we could, but it the apps cannot be removed. For these reasons, I gave it three stars.

Honestly, I am torn about this phone. For a starter phone, this is good. I wish it had the memory that it advertises. The body is all plastic, but it doesn't feel cheap. Currently, it's almost impossible to find a case for it unless you are willing to shell out $40 for sellers driving up the price on Ebay. Ironic, since most of us got the phone for $49 on Black Friday. I will update my review once we use the phones more.

Now you can have a phone with an easy-to-see screen and crisp, clear sound, thanks to the AT&T Huawei Ascend XT GoPhone Prepaid Smartphone. The HD display of this cellular accessory offers a bright, vivid viewing experience. The android smartphone is wonderful for browsing and making statements via social media. The smart design offers a large screen without being bulky, and its narrow body makes the Ascend XT easy to hold. This AT&T smartphone contains 2GB of RAM and 16GB of internal memory. It has a microSD card slot (card sold separately) that supports up to 32GB. This makes your memory easier to expand. pTitle: AT&T Huawei Ascend XT GoPhone Prepaid Smartphone
rText:
- I bought this phone during black-friday weekend for $49.
- Phones comes with nano sim card, but porting your phone over is a breeze with a simple call to AT&T.
- Android OS is somewhat current with Marshmallow 6.0.1 One update was detected on first check and installed successfully.
- Internal storage is limited to 16GB minus OS leaves you with 8GB. Then you subtract apps, etc.. I have less than 4GB free now. However SD card expansion fixes that issue as my 64GB card is supported. Storage is not an issue if you get an SD card.
- Phone is very responsive and display is crystal clear. 6" is great
- Finding a phone case was challenging online. I ended up going with the more expensive Body Glove case available in WalMart store for $20 (which has worked great). Although I was looking for something online in the range of $4-7 but they just don't make them yet for this phone
- Phone was such a great deal, I ended up getting a 2nd phone for the Mrs. to replace our sluggish Win 8 and Win 10 phones.

pTitle: AT&T Huawei Ascend XT GoPhone Prepaid Smartphone
rText:
I walked into my local Walmart prepared to sign a two year contract for a new device. I walked past the prepaid section and this device immediately caught my eye. The $150 price tag indicated that this phone might  have some considerable specs (for a Go Phone, that is) and when I saw that the phone had 2GB of RAM and 16 GB ROM, I knew I had to buy it. I don't typically like oversized phones like this one, but I couldn't pass up purchasing such a powerful phone relative to its price point.

That said, this phone is brand spanking new, so don't expect to be able to find any cases for it for a while. Heck, even AnTuTu benchmark was unable to verify what phone I was using. Google calls it a "Copper Plus", the box says "Ascend XT", but searches for "H1611" yielded the most results. 

Amyway, if you like/don't mind supersized devices that are largely plastic (no metal here, unfortunately) give the H1611 a shot...you won't be disappointed.

pTitle: AT&T Huawei Ascend XT GoPhone Prepaid Smartphone
rText:
I purchase this phone because I wanted a big screen. This phone has a 6" screen. Plenty for me. I read some of the reviews and was a little worried about buy the phone. But Walmart had the phone on roll back for 76.00. so I couldn't refuse. I also purchase the insurance in case the phone started acting stupid. But so far, everything good. I don't know why some people are having problems with this phone. Unless they are doing things with the phone that they have no business doing with the phone like jail breaking or rooting. Maybe they downloaded some applications that ain't compatible with the phone and causing the phone to act stupid, Or they got a lemon. I did notice that the phone was a little slow in the beginning so I went into setting and found a setting to change the phone performance mold. Now the phone seem to be quicker. I would suggest getting an micro SD card to store music and videos on it because the phone has about 8gig of storage that is usable.the camera take good pictures for my liking. I'm not an professional photographer so I'm looking for high performance camera just something to take occasion pictures. Now I do have some complaints about the phone. But for 76.00 I really can't complain. This isn't a 800.00 Samsung Galaxy 8. But my complaints are the battery doesn't come out so I can't carry a extra battery with me. So I'll have to use a external battery pack. Also it's hard to find a protective case locally so I'll have to go online for it. And by biggest complaint is not with the phone, but with the service. I have the att go plan. And on the go prepaid plan, att has the hotspot disabled so u can't use the phone hotspot feature. So if you want to hotspot then don't get the go plan. U will need to get att contract plan.  I wish I would have knew that before I brought the phone. Would have look some where else. But I do love the phone though.
.

pTitle: AT&T Huawei Ascend XT GoPhone Prepaid Smartphone
rText:
The phone is great for the price, nice body and style.  However, instead of the 16GB that you are suppose to get you really only have 8GB of usable storage.  Not to mention you can not delete the added apps.

Another downside is the case; my Walmart does not have a case.  I wish Walmart would sell the case online as well.   The screen is glass it would be wise to get a case and screen protector..  Nevertheless, the phone is nice and the $49 Black Friday price was very reasonable and affordable.

pTitle: AT&T Huawei Ascend XT GoPhone Prepaid Smartphone
rText: The speaker on this phone is poor quality. I am told by people that I call that they hear static and a muffled voice. I frequently have to restart to get the internet to work correctly (wi-fi and mobile data.) The phone is large and heavy so it is awkward to hold and use. It is difficult to know when a new voicemail is available. You have to look at the scroll down screen to find out.  I would not recommend this phone to anyone. Customer service and tech support are not knowledgeable or helpful. The tech support forum recommends to use mobile data for better call quality but it makes no difference. It is very difficult to determine where the SD card goes. The back cover is difficult to remove. It can take hours to receive and send a text message. The only good thing about this phone is that it holds up to thirty app's without using the SD card.

pTitle: AT&T Huawei Ascend XT GoPhone Prepaid Smartphone
rText: I bought this phone to replace an aging Samsung.  When I got to the store, this phone was no where to be found.  The employees had no idea what I was talking about when I asked about it.  Showed them the product description on walmart.com.  One associate was nice enough to go check in the back, sure enough, they had just came in.  The screen is very nice, and phone is fast enough to do everything I need.  Haven't thrown anything hardcore at it yet, but I'm sure it'll handle it fine.  Can't tell what the battery life is like as this is the first full day I've used it.  Overall great phone, best prepaid phone you can get on ATT unless you are willing to spend $500+ on a Galaxy S6

pTitle: AT&T Huawei Ascend XT GoPhone Prepaid Smartphone
rText:
While this is a GO Phone, I use Straighttalk (ATT sim card) and it works just fine.
This phone is loaded for the price and very fast when making calls or sending texts. 
I've only had it a couple of weeks but am a heavy user due to my job. The battery lasts me 2 days before I need to recharge it. It fits easily into my hand despite a 6" screen size and does not feel slick so I use no case. Still fits into my front pants pocket easily. Call quality is very good and music playback is good enough for me. Easily paired the bluetooth with my car audio. GPS works quickly and accurately. I haven't taken many pictures so not sure about the camera quality. It does not have NFC but with a transfer app it was easy to import my contacts and load the apps I wanted to keep.

pTitle: AT&T Huawei Ascend XT GoPhone Prepaid Smartphone
rText: Got the phone as a Black Friday special and it is great ... it may not have all the bells and whistles that the top end phones do but for what I want in a phone it is great.  It is a big phone, 6" screen, so some may not like that but it ihas a bright, clear screen that is easy to see.  The battery life is amazing, I can definitely go all day without recharging, in fact I have actually gone 2 days and still had 24% left. The camera is good as well (even better than my Grand Prime), and the processor keeps everything moving smooth.  I gave it a 4 because even though it is supposed to have 16Gb of memory it only lets you use 8. The only other complaint is not really the phones issue but rather a supply issue ... cases ... there is very little selection at this point, although Walmart does sell a Body Glove cover that I am using along with the tempered glass screen protector, so there is a few options for now. Bottom line, if you want a good performing phone with a large screen that takes good pics and can handle all your normal everyday tasks and doesn't have to be constantly recharged then this is definitely one to consider!

pTitle: AT&T Huawei Ascend XT GoPhone Prepaid Smartphone
rText:
Just bought 3 of these phones on Black Friday for $49, which was a great deal. Love the 6-inch screen. Battery life is great as are the graphics. The setup process is easy and AT and T will transfer the SIM card for you for free if the SIM in your old phone is too big (like mine was).

The only thing I don't like so far is the call volume.  It's very low and muddled sometimes and forget putting it on speaker unless you want to hold the phone to your ear the entire time.  

We initially couldn't find a phone case but we ended up going Walmart hopping around town today since we have several and found black Body Glove cases for $19.97 that was specifically for this particular phone.  So, best advice...if you can't find a case at your location, look at other ones...you might get lucky!

rText: This phone is awesome!! I german shepard chewed up my Note 4 (darn it!!) and thought I woud be out of hunreds of dollars to replace it. Did a little shopping and came across phone. has all the capibilities a smart phone should have. Decemt amount of memroy for apps, music, pics, etc...Very nice screen size and it was only $49.00. You simply can't beat that! The phone was so nice my son wanted one too. I highly recommend this phone for ppl that like large screens and don't want to pay and arm and a leg through a contracted phone. There's a reason why this phone is selling so fast. good phone for a excellent price!!! very happy!!
rTitle: A very nice phone for an excellent price!!

pTitle: AT&T Huawei Ascend XT GoPhone Prepaid Smartphone
rText:
I got this on a Black Friday sale because of the price.  I figured I would end up giving it to the kids or using it to replace my failing B&N Nook.  I was skeptical about how I would like it considering how I'm used to the Samsung Galaxy series, and I find most other phones to be lacking in the camera, screen quality, and general performance.  So I was very suprised by the Ascend XT.

The screen is good, earning at least an A- from me.  It's not 1080p, but I don't hold my phone 6 inches from my face and look for pixels.  Colors and contrast are good enough, and the outdoor visibility is good thanks to one of the best auto-brightness systems I've come across.  And it's an IPS display, so the viewing angles are great.

The camera is also good.  I give it a B+.  The 8MP hardware doesn't match the 8MP from my 5 year old Galaxy S2, but the images are decent.  Where the camera impressed me is the app itself.  The HDR mode was easy to use and does yield images that on par with my old Galaxy (which still works and I used for comparison).  It has a very easy to use voice activation for taking photos.  And it includes a document scanner (cropper) which I use frequently.

And for the performance we start the story with a slight disappointment.  It has 2GB of RAM and way more CPU cores that my old S2, but it was just barely faster.  Still good performance for the price, and way better than other budget phones.  But I was expecting more.  Then fast forward past a couple over-the-air updates, adding a high-speed SD card, and installing the Nova Launcher.  The phone is now noticeably faster and operates with more available RAM.  So it now impresses me with it's multitasking, responsiveness, and how it handles the light gaming I do.  It still won't keep up with the newest flagship models, but it blows away everything else I've seen for under $100.

As for bloatware - there's some, but I was able to remove or disable pretty much all of it very easily, and it wasn't really that bad to begin with compared to some other phones I've seen.

Durability is good.  I did get a screen protector, but do not use a case.  It's had at least 3 bad falls so far, and suffered only scratches on the corners.  

So my overall score is 5 stars.  Now, if I were to score it on the same scale one would use for something like the S8 or the Nexus phones, then I would rate the Hauwei Ascend at barely 3 strars.  But they aren't on the same scale.  Most flagships are at least 4 or 5 times more expensive than this phone.  So once you consider that this one is less than $100, it's an unbeatable value.

pTitle: AT&T Huawei Ascend XT GoPhone Prepaid Smartphone
rText:
I bought this phone for my husband hoping the touch pad would be large enough for him to see without putting his glasses on.  The touch pad was a good size.  The things I rated it low on were: 1) The speaker is not good.  Way too much garble.  This makes it hard for my husband to understand what is being said.  If he doesn't put it on speaker phone, the volume doesn't go loud enough for him to hear well...unless of course the person on the other line peaks rather loudly.  2) The Hotspot turns off as soon as you disconnect your other device from it.  3) The mobile data turns itself on whether you want it on or not.  We have to check it frequently to make sure it is off when we are not using the net. 
The good: This phone does have pretty decent cell signal reception.

Couldn't find a case at all, but I went to another Walmart located about 40 miles from where I lived and found a body glove case which fit it perfectly. The case itself was $20, but was on sale there for$10. I had ordered screen protectors from Amazon, which on took a few days to get. I am very satisfied with this phone. I haven't had any problems and do not have any complaints. Will I buy this same phone again? Yes. I will definitely recommend this phone to everyone. You can't go wrong with the price and size.

pTitle: AT&T Huawei Ascend XT GoPhone Prepaid Smartphone
rText: I bought this phone to replace an LG Phoenix 2 which has the same 720p screen resolution. The screen on the Ascend is fantastic. I find the 6" form factor to be extremely comfortable for large hands. The Snapdragon 616 processor handles tasks with ease but the GPU lacks the horsepower required for gaming. So far, the camera has impressed me and is far better than the Phoenix 2, although neither are compatible with the Google Cardboard Camera app. Battery life is also better. The Ascend XT does support wireless display for screen mirroring to Roku or Mi Box.  The only issue I've run into thus far was with the Messaging app which seems to auto scroll on its own for no reason.

pTitle: AT&T Huawei Ascend XT GoPhone Prepaid Smartphone
rText:
Like many people that I have seen on the web, I picked up the Huawei Ascend XT on Black Friday weekend from Walmart for $49.00, which was a steal and an impulse buy.  I wanted to get it as a backup phone in the event something happened to one of our other phones.  This phone is being sold as an AT&T GoPhone and appears to be a Walmart exclusive, but it just as easily could be used on any of AT&Ts plans.

So, here are my impressions of the phone.  I will start with the hardware.  The case of the phone is one piece plastic which has a nice rounded feel to it.  This phone feels and looks better than most plastic phones that I have seen.  The power and volume buttons are placed on the right side of the phone with the power button being just below the volume buttons.  This makes it easy to hit the volume button when going for the power button and vice versa.  The speaker is on the bottom of the phone and is nice and loud and has a good sound to it.  The screen is 6.0” and is 720x1280. I find the display to be quite good and bight.  The icons will be bigger on this phone than on another phone with higher resolution.  I did not have a problem with the display being only 720x1280.

The phone performs quite well in most circumstances, I did find some lag in typing on some web pages, but most were quite responsive.  I had no problems playing casual games and the phone handled games like Temple Run 2 quite well.  I couple of issues that I noticed were 1) sometimes when sliding from one homescreen to the next, the widgets would redraw on the homescreen that you are sliding to.  This is probably due to Huawei getting aggressive with battery life, 2)  it is too easy to tap the home button to go home or close an app and cause Google Now on Tap to launch if you have it activated.  This feature is supposed to perform a search related to what’s on the screen when you hold down on the home button.  I found it way too easy to activate this by just doing a normal tap on the home button.

Huawei has skinned Android with their eMUI 4.1 skin, which was not as bad as I thought it was going to be.  There are a couple of things to note on this.  In the App drawer you cannot create folders and group your apps together, you can only do that on the home screen.  I am used to having shortcuts and notifications available when you pull down the notification shade.  Huawei separates outs the Notifications and the Shortcuts into 2 separate tabs. This means that you see more of your notifications, but if you want to toggle WiFi or some other service on or off, you have to tap the Shortcuts tab to do that instead of it being at the top of the notifications screen.  

One of the odd things I found on the Ascend XT was how they deal with the wallpaper.  The default lock screen wallpaper rotates between 20 different images and if you want to change the wallpaper on the lock screen, it has to be the same as the home screen.  There are 2 ways to get around this, one is to install an alternate lock screen app or to remove the contents of the MagazineUnlock folder and put your photo in there.  The photo has to be 720x1280 and named like the photos that you removed from the MagazineUnlock folder (hopefully you moved them to another folder and not deleted them).

This phone has a 3,000 mAh battery (which is non-removable) and it has no problem getting you through the day.  I have used this phone all day with a good 4 hours or more of Screen time and did not exhaust the battery.  This is probably due to the screen resolution being 720x1280, meaning it does not have to refresh as many pixels as some other phones with higher resolution and battery optimizations that Huawei is doing behind the scenes.  If you are not a heavy phone user, you could probably get two days use on a full battery.

The call quality on this phone is very good I had no problems with dropped calls and the calls sounded very clear.  The rear camera is an 8 megapixel camera with LED flash.  It takes good photos with plenty of light, but when things are a little darker you will see a lot of detail missing in the photo when you zoom in.  The Ascend XT will handle a 64 GB micro SD card without any problems.

So, what are my final thoughts on this phone, it is a good phone and it is worth getting at $100, which is Walmart current price on this phone.  With a $100 phone you are not going to get the quality, speed and refinement of a flagship phone that costs 7 0r 8 times more.  But if you are on a budget or don’t want to spend that $800 for the next best thing, give this phone a try.  My only regret is that I wish I had bought another one at the Black Friday price.
rTitle: A very good phone at a great price

pDescr:

The HD display of this cellular accessory offers a bright, vivid viewing experience. The android smartphone is wonderful for browsing and making statements via social media. The smart design offers a large screen without being bulky, and its narrow body makes the Ascend XT easy to hold. This AT&T smartphone contains 2GB of RAM and 16GB of internal memory. pTitle: AT&T Huawei Ascend XT GoPhone Prepaid Smartphone
rText: Like many people, bought this on black Friday for $50. Hands down best phone I've ever had. First charge went fast and was concerned the battery would be awful, but after the first discharge, battery has improved a lot. User interface is great.  This is a great buy even at the full price of $149. And as always, AT&T service has been fantastic for me and their customer service in my experience is light years better than Verizon prepaid customer service.  Hoping more phone cases become available in the near future.

pTitle: AT&T Huawei Ascend XT GoPhone Prepaid Smartphone
rText:
Big clear 6" screen.  Phone feels very solid...not cheap at all.  AT&T kindly unlocked the phone so I am using it with Family Mobile (T-Mobile).  Got as a black Friday special for $50.  I don't need the most advanced phone because I use multiple desktops for most things and have a DSLR camera to take important photos.

The phone's main con is the battery is not removable and it needs to be charged more often than my old ZTE Zmax 2, which could go for 2 days without a charge.  The Huawei Ascend XT can go about 1 day and a half.  Both have 3000mAh batteries.

pTitle: AT&T Huawei Ascend XT GoPhone Prepaid Smartphone
rText:
I have some answers to guestions that were posted. 

1. I bought 2 of these phones and they were locked too. I contacted Customer Support and they informed me that the phones were not scanned properly at the store. I emailed them my receipt with my name and both ime #'s of the phones and they unlocked them once they received proof of purchase.

2. The Body Glove case appears to be only sold at Walmart for $19.88.  The store I purchased it at and the store I frequent often are really busy stores and did not have them. So I called another smaller store in my area that isn't quite as busy and they had several in stock. Needless to say we ran straight to the store and got them.  Make some phone calls!

Hope this helps!!

rText: I've owned top of the line smartphones dating back to the last few years (Samsung Note's). Honestly, I was tired of keeping up with latest and greatest (my bank account was too). For $49 this phone can't be beat. Large display, speedy performance, unique software, decent camera and phenomenal battery life! Don't hesitate, get it! I actually picked up two on black Friday. There is also a case sold at Wal-Mart called the body glove for $20 (black).  $49 for a 6 inch beast? I'll take that!

pTitle: AT&T Huawei Ascend XT GoPhone Prepaid Smartphone
rText: Good 6 inches screen size phone for the price. Got it on Black Friday for $50. Surprisingly the hardware quality is pretty good. I wished the power button located on top of the phone. Always tried to avoid pressing the power button when holding the phone.The ZTE Zmax 2 had better screen and camera qualities. May be the 5.5 inches on the Zmax 2 and also an AT&T GoPhone. Software wise is another issue. For example, the phone has the screen lock features; Pattern, PIN, and Password. It did not has the None feature liked my LG G2 does. Once I set the security PIN, the only way to remove or unwanted that feature is to reset the phone. There go my settings and apps. Some apps did not run well on this phone. May be the Marshmallow operating system. I hope someone can help me with the security screen feature. Thanks.

rText: This is a great phone.  It has a great display bright and clean.  I don't think it would be must better if it was 1080p. It has a large feel to it almost a little big. pTitle: AT&T Huawei Ascend XT GoPhone Prepaid Smartphone
rText: Picked up the Huawei Ascend XT (H1611) on Black Friday for $49.00 to replace an older Android phone.  I wasn't expecting much due to the low price.   So far the phone has performed flawlessly.  Calls are clear, photos are good enough, and all my favorite apps work.  It is a little bigger than I expected, but I am getting use to it.  The Body Glove case I found at WalMart is a little pricey ($19.99), but it was the only case available since the phone was only released in October 2016.  Overall, I am happy with my purchase and would recommend the item to a friend.

pTitle: AT&T Huawei Ascend XT GoPhone Prepaid Smartphone
rText:
No brainer at $50 on Black Friday but even at $99 it's still one of the best phones and better than most tablets on the market.  At $150 it's not competitive with the ZTE Zmax Pro.

Pros are very likely to get carrier unlock approved, bootloader unlock from Huawei, solid build quality with metal frame and carbon fiber like back, great 6" display even at 720p, good performance with Snapdragon 616 eight-core when changed to performance mode in settings and long 8 hours screen-on-time when used as a tablet on WIFI with radio disabled.

rText: I did quite a bit of research before purchasing this phone.  It was very easy to unlock (I am not an AT&T customer).  The price of this phone is great, especially with the features this phone offers.  The camera is adequate for my needs.  My main concern was the battery.  I haven't had the phone that long but no complaints so far.  I would not recommend this phone for people who are heavy gamers on their phone but for a casual user, it is perfect.

rText: Got this for $49, but it is also an excellent deal at $79.  Specs are decent, screen is bright and clear, and processing is fine for most day to day tasks. I can't say anything about call quality or camera as I have not been able to use these functions yet.

pTitle: AT&T Huawei Ascend XT GoPhone Prepaid Smartphone
rText: I usually have nicer phones, but I couldn't turn down the $49 price tag on Black Friday.  I bought it as a backup phone and thought I would carry it a few days to check it out, but after two weeks I am still carrying it. I thought it would be too big for my hands, but I do not have a case on it and it does fit comfortably in my hand. I am not a gamer, but it handles email, web surfing, Netflix, YouTube and any other app I've thrown at it. I wish I'd bought two at the $49. Battery life is excellent. There's not too much bloatware, except from AT&T, of course. The price is back to $99, and I feel it's still a bargain at that price.  Just a pretty nice phone overall. And for $49, it's excellent!
rTitle: A very good deal for the money

rText:
The phone is advertised "up to 16gb of internal" on the box and 16gb by Walmart, however the actual phone only has 8.5gb of storage and 1.8gb of RAM. Since i bought it on black friday for a very good price, i am giving it 3 stars otherwise i would give it 2 stars.
I have average sized hands for an Asian and i find the phone itself is getting very near the limits for me to hold. I am using it more due to it's tablet like size. The screen is reasonably sharp and the colours are nice.

pDescr:
Now you can have a phone with an easy-to-see screen and crisp, clear sound, thanks to the AT&T Huawei Ascend XT GoPhone Prepaid Smartphone. The HD display of this cellular accessory offers a bright, vivid viewing experience. The android smartphone is wonderful for browsing and making statements via social media. The smart design offers a large screen without being bulky, and its narrow body makes the Ascend XT easy to hold. This AT&T smartphone contains 2GB of RAM and 16GB of internal memory. It has a microSD card slot (card sold separately) that supports up to 32GB. This makes your memory easier to expand. You get up to 17 hours of talk time, giving you plenty of hours to make calls to friends and family. And you can take nice photos with an 8MP rear-facing camera. Have a phone with plenty of useful features when you own the AT&T Huawei Ascend XT GoPhone Prepaid Smartphone.

Now you can have a phone with an easy-to-see screen and crisp, clear sound, thanks to the AT&T Huawei Ascend XT GoPhone Prepaid Smartphone. The HD display of this cellular accessory offers a bright, vivid viewing experience. The android smartphone is wonderful for browsing and making statements via social media. The smart design offers a large screen without being bulky, and its narrow body makes the Ascend XT easy to hold. This AT&T smartphone contains 2GB of RAM and 16GB of internal memory. It has a microSD card slot (card sold separately) that supports up to 32GB. This makes your memory easier to expand. You get up to 17 hours of talk time, giving you plenty of hours to make calls to friends and family. And you can take nice photos with an 8MP rear-facing camera. Have a phone with plenty of useful features when you own the AT&T Huawei Ascend XT GoPhone Prepaid Smartphone.

pTitle: Refurbished Verizon Samsung Galaxy S4 I545 Smartphone (Unlocked)
rText:
This was advertised as a unlocked Verizon phone - which is correct. However, the seller didn't say or didn't know that Verizon removed the Message Center from Galaxy S4 phones such that they can do everything EXCEPT send text messages from non-Verizon carriers. Since being able to send outgoing texts is a key feature for a phone, this made it unusable.  

Please note that I attempted to root and update the phone, so it's not just that I'm a non-tech person who can't figure it out. This phone was not fully functional for a non-Verizon user.

pTitle: Refurbished Verizon Samsung Galaxy S4 I545 Smartphone (Unlocked)
rText: I like the unit so far and the best thing about it was that it's unlocked and I can use it with Tracfone's BYOP program, no issues. Battery time could be better, constantly charging, you really have to turn down screen brightness and turn off services that use a lot of power, but that's not too big of a deal because I just turn them on when I need them. For the money it's a great deal. I mean, it's not an S6 or anything, but it doesn't cost $600+ either! Overall I'm pleased. Caution: ONLY WORKS WITH CDMA NETWORKS, AKA VERIZON and carriers who use their towers!!! These phones were once Verizon phones and were unlocked by Verizon to sell off and make way for the new phones.

pTitle: Refurbished Verizon Samsung Galaxy S4 I545 Smartphone (Unlocked)
rText:
I called requesting an unlock code for this phone, which was to have already arrive unlocked.
JEG & Son vendor was a bit rude & claimed they'd contact me with the code.
HAving never heard back from them, I called & spent 25 minutes on the phone with an even ruder employee who wouldn't/wouldn't search for the status of my phone & continually insisted on refunding the phone that I very much need for my flight tomorrow!
It wasn't until I asked for a manager, before my questions were finally answered & they took a few minutes to find out they weren't able to obtain the unlock code & I had to return the phone.

pTitle: Verizon Moto G Play Prepaid Smartphone
rText: This is an absolutely great phone and for a simply amazing  price. The 16G memory is just what I needed for the apps I use. The only issue I found was that Moto stock software does not provide text notifications on the icon, as did my LG phone. However, I loaded a free home page Launcher which provides notifications and everything is working great. Delivery was very quick too.

pTitle: Verizon Moto G Play Prepaid Smartphone
rText: I went from a Nokia Windows 8 phone (upgraded to windows 10) to this phone since that phone died on me after a good year of working.  I have had 4 or 5 different Android phones in the past and was always happy with how they worked.  But this phone far exceeds all my expectations for a $80 prepaid phone.  I was lucky to get the last one off the shelf at my local Walmart.  The set up was super easy and I was and am still amazed at how fast this phone is.  It is very responsive and works flawlessly with all the software I have installed on it.   The colors are very sharp and clear and the screen resolution is superb.   I originally bought this to be a 'fill-in' phone until the new microsoft phones come out, but as great as this has been I don't even feel the need to look elsewhere.  If anything I may be looking to get a high end Motorola phone cause if this phone is any indication of how well this company makes phone I can only imagine the high end ones are even better.  Great phone for the price and does EVERYTHING (and more) that it advertises.  <-- One happy Moto owner.

pTitle: Verizon Moto G Play Prepaid Smartphone
rText: So happy I found this phone. I had a first generation Moto G that I loved, but it just didn't have enough storage, so I switched in August 2016 to a more expensive phone, but had so much trouble that I bought this phone less than a year later. It is a full-featured, well thought out phone. 16 GB internal storage with the option to add up to 128 GB through a micro-SD card. Great tactile feedback. Inexpensive cases available for it online. Very good battery life so far, and the camera takes great pictures. Very happy with this phone.

pTitle: Verizon Moto G Play Prepaid Smartphone
rText: I bought this as a replacement for my old 3G Moto G device and man am I glad that I did! They are not even joking when they say all day battery life. I kid you not I activated my phone on a Friday night, used it all weekend, and didn't even have to charge it until Monday morning. Yep. That's right, two full days of use for texting, calls and checking my email. I use my phone more for texting than anything else so I'm sure if you were streaming YouTube or something your battery wouldn't last as long. The screen is clear and vivid and does everything I need this phone to do. I was so pleased with it I even bought one for my mom for mothers day and got her to switch carriers. She has nothing but positive things to say about it also! Kudos Motorola for making such a fantastic product!
rTitle: Amazing phone with looooooong battery life

pTitle: Verizon Moto G Play Prepaid Smartphone
rText:
This phone is thin, light, durable, fast, great call quality and long battery life. It has some water resistance and only a few unwanted apps. Near stock Android experience. The only thing it doesn't have is a fingerprint sensor. It is literally impossible to get a better phone for this much money. 

My wife and I both have this phone and we both, for different reasons, love it!

If you have $89 to buy a Verizon phone then buy THIS PHONE.

Peace!
rTitle: Dare I say this phone is beautiful?

pTitle: Verizon Moto G Play Prepaid Smartphone
rText: I've been an iPhone4  user for the last 4 years.  Badly needed to upgrade as the phone was having problems.  Could not justify upgrading to another iPhone price was issue for me but needed a new phone.  After much research and reading reviews I took a chance on the Verizon Motor G Play,  I was surprised how fast it was, does everything I need in a phone.  It's still a smart phone and I was able to download all the apps I wanted.  For the price it's an awesome phone.  Found I didn't need to spend hugh amount of money for a phone to meet my needs,

pTitle: Verizon Moto G Play Prepaid Smartphone
rText:
The Verizon Moto G4 Play is a bit of a throwback with its thick metal band sides and deceptive size that in the end contain a small 5 inch screen.
The Marshmallow operating system is what really saves the day with a lot of added and time saving features over Lollipop.
Durability is only fair as the old style wrap around frame is subject to denting and therefore cracking the screen which is made of gen 3 Gorilla glass.
Non slippy back is a good feature but in the end you will likely want to get rubberized impact protection.
Annoying features are its oversized for its small screen, the screen is for some reason a dust magnet while battery live is poor and charge time even when completely turned off....it recharges VERY slow.
Where it shines it phone sound quality and the ability to work well even with just one bar signal strength.
Also it has a very good camera which is a plus but somewhat odd considering.
Online performance is good IF you avoid the Opera browsers which really put a drag on internet performance, best browser for data saving and speed is the UC browser.
Overall for what it is it is a $29.00 phone at best so it is all about how bad you want it and wether or not you are using rose colored glasses.

This phone reluctantly replaces my favorite LG Premier because Verizon doesn't support it, but moving to the Moto from the Premier is like going from a BMW to a Fiat.

pTitle: Verizon Moto G Play Prepaid Smartphone
rText: I do like this phone but Verizon will not allow you to access data during phone calls. When the data is on and your not on a call, your connection is 4G LTE. But when you get a call, the connection switches to a 1X connection and disconnects your data. My car relies on a always on data connection for my safety and Verizon restricting this is unacceptable. The actual sim that comes with this phone isn't even an authentic 4G LTE sim. I am really disappointed in Verizon.  From forums I have read I came to understand that post paid accounts are allowed the always on data connection but prepaid isn't. This is also a negative mark in my book. So don't waste your money if you are looking for a modern prepaid device. This one is from the caveman cell phone era.
rTitle: No always on data connection for prepaid
